required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interpersonal Relationships Intervention and Cardiovascular Health
clinical_study.official_title: An Interpersonal Relationships Intervention for Improving Cardiovascular Health in Youth

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether random assignment to a mentor-mentee relationship is associated with beneficial cardiovascular health effects in both mentors and mentees.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be undergraduate students randomly assigned to either being in the mentor or comparison group. A second set of participants will be randomly assigned to either being in the mentee or comparison group. These participants will come from Chicago Public School elementary schools. In total, there will be 125 mentors, 125 comparators, 125 mentees, and 125 comparators. Participants will come for a laboratory visit in which cardiovascular health measures will be taken (details below). Visits will occur once at baseline (before the intervention starts), and once post-intervention. There will be a mid-point assessment of questionnaires. Participants in the intervention group will engage in one-on-one mentoring sessions (mentors together with mentees) once a week after school for the school year. Participants in the comparator group will receive written versions of all materials covered in the mentoring sessions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in metabolic symptoms from baseline to approximately 1 year later
primary_outcome.description: Metabolic symptoms per International Diabetes Federation guidelines

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in flow-mediated vasodilation from baseline to approximately 1 year later
Change in HOMA-IR score from baseline to approximately 1 year later
primary_outcome.description: Homeostatic Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to approximately 1 year later
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized and averaged values of pro-inflammatory cytokines + CRP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to approximately 1 year later
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized and averaged values of stimulated pro-inflammatory cytokines

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to approximately 1 year later
secondary_outcome.description: Standardized and averaged values of cytokine production after stimulation plus addition of cortisol

arm_group.description: Youth in the intervention group will participate in one-on-one mentoring sessions (between mentors and mentees) once per week after school. Mentoring sessions will focus on social relationships, coping behaviors, and healthy lifestyles.
Youth in the comparator group will receive written versions of all materials covered in the mentoring sessions.

intervention.description: The intervention will include one-on-one mentoring sessions held after school, focusing on coping, social relationships, and healthy lifestyles.
Written materials from the mentoring sessions will be provided to those in the comparison group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- undergraduate students for mentors
- Chicago Public School students for mentees
Exclusion Criteria:
-
